fields.headline: Travel news in brief
fields.bodyText: Package sales down on 2002 Early indications are that the start of the January sales in high-street travel agents are sluggish, down by as much as 20% between Christmas and new year. Figures issued this week for summer 2002 show that the number of package holidays sold dropped for the first time since the Gulf War in 1991, down by 6.1 %. Jet2 adds Alicante Jet2, the low-cost airline based at Leeds-Bradford airport, has added Alicante to its routes. Flights to the Costa Blanca will start on April 12 with fares from £29 one-way (including taxes). The new airline launches with flights to Amsterdam on February 12. Other routes include Barcelona, Malaga, Nice, Palma and Milan. Bookings on 0870 7378282, jet2.com. Guernsey route Aurigny, the Channel Island airline, launches a year-round service from Bristol to Guernsey from the end of March; the route was dropped by BA subsidiary Brymon Airways. Return fares start at £84 including taxes. Bookings on 0871 8710717, aurigny.com. Ryanair sale Ryanair is holding its new year sale on its website this weekend with one-way fares from £10. The sale of flights between January 10 and April 13 must be booked by midnight on Monday on ryanair.com.
